page.title: 01Easington
page.content: Easington is divided into towo villages, Easington Village and Easington Colliery. They are connected by the B1203 road which is called Seaside Lane. This is the main road which runs through the middle of Easington Colliery. Most of the shops are on either side of Seaside Lane. There are many different kinds of shops. Easington Colliery is a mining community. It is situated on the Durham coast about half way between Sunderland and Hartlepool. It has a population of about 10000 people. Until 1900 the land which is now covered by the Colliery was entirely farm land. A rough path led down to the sea from Easington Village and this later became Seaside Lane.
